result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol.

Authorizations/Releases  - The defendant shall provide copy of this agreement with criminal complaint to treatment providers.  No further law violations.  Provide proof of compliance. Mental Health Treatment/Counseling.

timeConds.notes: To perform 40 hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kaia Katherine Beckstrom

records.addlTxt: Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on September 25, 2023 at 09:20 am.

2:20 PM Defendant Kaia Katherine Beckstrom in court.  Attorney Shannon Viel in court for Kaia Katherine Beckstrom.  Prosecuting attorney Aleksandra Hodowany in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions where matter is at. Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, withholds acceptance of plea on ct.2. Count 1 dismissed outright. Defendant is accepting the states offer for a DJA     Court reviews conditions contained within DJA, approves DJA. Bond remains in effect.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 25, 2023 at 09:20 am.
Status conference on October 25, 2022 at 02:20 pm.

9:29 AM Defendant Kaia Katherine Beckstrom in court.  Attorney Shannon Viel in court for Kaia Katherine Beckstrom.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. Court questions where matter is at.  Atty Viel requests another status date.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 02:20 pm.
Status conference on September 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

3:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kaia Katherine Beckstrom appeared by video. Atty Shannon Viel in court for Kaia Beckstrom. Atty Viel requests another status.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

No violent contact with E.B.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol.   Take medication as prescribed by physician.

1:00 PM   Defendant Kaia Katherine Beckstrom appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Attorney Kevin Martin appears by video for Kaia Beckstrom.   Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel.  Atty Martin indicates defendant qualifies for SPD representation, advises SPD will be appointing counsel to represent defendant. Atty Martin would like to proceed with initial appearance today, waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea.  Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Court questions defendant on address/employment.  Bond set.
Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
